qa_pairs.question: Part 1: What headline, author/timestamp, and core recapitalization change are stated at the top of the article?
qa_pairs.answer: OpenAI completes its for-profit recapitalization | TechCrunch Image Credits: Kim Jae-Hwan/SOPA Images/LightRocket / Getty Images AI OpenAI completes its for-profit recapitalization Russell Brandom 7:30 AM PDT · October 28, 2025 OpenAI on Tuesday said it had completed its recapitalization, splitting the AI lab into a for-profit corporation nested inside a non-profit foundation

qa_pairs.question: Part 2: Whose opposition to the legal process does the piece emphasize?
qa_pairs.answer: It’s the end result of a complex legal process that had been strenuously resisted by its estranged co-founder, Elon Musk

qa_pairs.question: Part 3: Under the new setup, who has legal control over what entity, and what freedoms does that grant?
qa_pairs.answer: Under the new structure, the non-profit OpenAI Foundation will have legal control over a public benefit corporation called OpenAI Group, which is free to raise funding or acquire companies without legal restraint

qa_pairs.question: Part 4: What stake and board-appointment powers will the Foundation hold?
qa_pairs.answer: The Foundation will hold a significant stake in OpenAI Group, and will appoint its board of directors

qa_pairs.question: Part 5: What principle does Brett Taylor highlight in his quoted blog post?
qa_pairs.answer: “We believe that the world’s most powerful technology must be developed in a way that reflects the world’s collective interests,” OpenAI chairman Brett Taylor wrote in a blog post

qa_pairs.question: Part 6: What ownership percentage will the Foundation initially hold, and what warrant condition is mentioned?
qa_pairs.answer: “The close of our recapitalization gives us the ability to keep pushing the frontier of AI, and an updated corporate structure to ensure progress serves everyone.” Under the new structure , the OpenAI Foundation will own 26% of the for-profit, with a warrant for additional shares to be granted if the company continues to grow

qa_pairs.question: Part 7: What stake and valuation figure are attributed to Microsoft, and who holds the remainder?
qa_pairs.answer: Microsoft, an early investor in OpenAI, will hold a roughly 27% stake, valued at about $135 billion, with the remaining 47% held by investors and employees

qa_pairs.question: Part 8: What does Microsoft say about the duration of its IP rights to OpenAI models?
qa_pairs.answer: According to a separate blog post by Microsoft , the deal will also extend Microsoft’s IP rights to OpenAI models through 2032

qa_pairs.question: Part 9: If OpenAI declares AGI, what independent verification step is required?
qa_pairs.answer: If OpenAI ever declares that it has achieved its long-held goal of artificial general intelligence, the deal will also require it to submit to an independent expert panel for verification

qa_pairs.question: Part 10: How was OpenAI structured before this deal, and why had that become difficult?
qa_pairs.answer: Prior to this recapitalization, OpenAI was operating as a non-profit under strict equity restrictions — a position that became increasingly untenable as the company’s fundraising became more ambitious

qa_pairs.question: Part 1: What page title and initial descriptor (including disambiguations) appear at the top?
qa_pairs.answer: OpenAI - Wikipedia Jump to content From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Artificial intelligence research organization Not to be confused with OpenAL , OpenAPI , or Open-source artificial intelligence

qa_pairs.question: Part 2: Which specific legal entity name is listed immediately afterward?
qa_pairs.answer: OpenAI, Inc

qa_pairs.question: Part 7: How does the article describe OpenAI’s national identity and location?
qa_pairs.answer: is an American artificial intelligence (AI) organization headquartered in San Francisco, California

qa_pairs.question: Part 8: What aim does OpenAI state, and how does it define AGI?
qa_pairs.answer: It aims to develop safe and beneficial artificial general intelligence (AGI), which it defines as highly autonomous systems that outperform humans at most economically valuable work

qa_pairs.question: Part 9: Which well-known model families does the article say OpenAI is known for?
qa_pairs.answer: [ 6 ] As a leading organization in the ongoing AI boom , [ 7 ] OpenAI is known for the GPT family of large language models , the DALL-E series of text-to-image models , and a text-to-video model named Sora

qa_pairs.question: Part 10: What effect did the November 2022 release of ChatGPT reportedly have?
qa_pairs.answer: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] Its release of ChatGPT in November 2022 has been credited with catalyzing widespread interest in generative AI
